intro: Leptorkis ferruginea, commonly known as the rusty leaved daisies, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies, sunflowers, and thistles. The plant is characterized by its small, yellow flowers surrounded by pale pink to brownish bracts. It typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and thrives in full sun. Leptorkis ferruginea is often found in arid and semi-arid regions, showcasing its adaptability to harsh environments.
